description: From shun +‎ -less (suffix meaning ‘lacking, without’), probably popularized by the English playwright William Shakespeare (1564–1616) by its use in his play Coriolanus (c. 1608–1609): see the quotation.

adjectives.description: shunless (comparative more shunless, superlative most shunless)

entries.meaning: (literary) That cannot be shunned; not to be avoided; inevitable, unavoidable.
